item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, May 2, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Redis is open source again (1612 points | 592 comments)
2. Irish privacy watchdog hits TikTok with Є530M fine over data transfers to China (47 points | 19 comments)
3. GPT-FoxNewsDad: A GPT designed to help tech/academia people with life struggles (5 points | discuss)
4. Just redesigned my personal site with a TTY-style interface (30 points | 18 comments)
5. RustAssistant: Using LLMs to Fix Compilation Errors in Rust Code (48 points | 26 comments)
6. Claude Integrations (596 points | 217 comments)
7. Bloom Filters (71 points | 15 comments)
8. Third party cookies must be removed (336 points | 158 comments)
9. Show HN: OSle – A 510 bytes OS in x86 assembly (48 points | 14 comments)
10. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (May 2025) (188 points | 198 comments)
11. Anubis saved our websites from a DDoS attack (271 points | 191 comments)
12. Felix86: Run x86-64 programs on RISC-V Linux (88 points | 19 comments)
13. Owen Le Blanc: creator of the first Linux distribution (74 points | 9 comments)
14. Dopamine signals when a fear can be forgotten (169 points | 105 comments)
15. LLMs for Engineering: Teaching Models to Design High Powered Rockets (80 points | 22 comments)
16. Llasa: Llama-Based Speech Synthesis (150 points | 17 comments)
17. Linkwarden: FOSS self-hostable bookmarking with AI-tagging and page archival (279 points | 95 comments)
18. DECtalk Archive (83 points | 14 comments)
19. New Study: Waymo is reducing serious crashes and making streets safer (284 points | 289 comments)
20. AI code review: Should the author be the reviewer? (106 points | 66 comments)
21. Show HN: Kubetail – Real-time log search for Kubernetes (94 points | 28 comments)
22. Judge rules Apple executive lied under oath, makes criminal contempt referral (955 points | 321 comments)
23. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (May 2025) (84 points | 196 comments)
24. Millihertz 5 Mechanical Computer (2022) (89 points | 13 comments)
25. The Totalitarian Buddhist Who Beat SIM City (2010) (3 points | discuss)
26. xAI dev leaks API key for private SpaceX, Tesla LLMs (158 points | 36 comments)
27. C++26: more constexpr in the standard library (71 points | 40 comments)
28. Starting July 1, academic publishers can't paywall NIH-funded research (534 points | 94 comments)
29. Trust Me, I'm Local: Chrome Extensions, MCP, and the Sandbox Escape (135 points | 36 comments)
30. Oxide’s compensation model: how is it going? (227 points | 198 comments)
